item.title: Meteoric Water Lines from GNIP data
item.description: The tutorial contains: * theoretical background of the GMWL * Data pre-processing * linear regression analyses (LMWLs) * result visualization in geographic map The tutorial depends on the following packages: * library(dplyr) * library(purrr) * library(tidyr) * library(zoo) *library(ggplot2) Theoretical Backround The hydrogen and oxygen isotopic signatures of precipitation are related on a global scale. The relationship was first observed by Harmon Craig (1961), who defined the Global Meteoric Water Line (GMWL):
